title: S.O.L.I.D
description: The S.O.L.I.D is a set of five design principles for object-oriented programming that help make software designs more understandable, flexible and maintainable.
content: The acronym representing five key design principles: Single Responsibility, Open-Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation and Dependency Inversion. These principles guide developers to write cleaner and more maintainable code.
